alert.note: Alert for East Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet; Otero Mesa; Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet; Southern Tularosa Basin; West Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued March 06 at 6:06AM MST until March 06 at 7:00PM MST by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 7 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...West winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. Some east slope locations and area passes may see stronger gusts. * WHERE...Areas east of the Rio Grande Valley of New Mexico and portions of Far West Texas. This includes eastern Dona Ana and El Paso counties as well as all of Hudspeth and much of Otero counties. * WHEN...From noon to 7 PM MST Sunday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strong winds will make driving hazardous, especially along north/south running roads and highways. The strong winds will also create areas of blowing dust which will cause quickly changing visibilities for motorists. Wild fire danger will be elevated.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects.
